There are three scoring ranks for sales, and you will receive a satisfaction rating as you serve customers. Serve as many customers as possible in a short about of time, increase your score, and aim for high customer satisfaction.
You might even have some friends stop by near the end of your shift!
Title: Shaved Ice Shuffle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shooting Challenge</color>
Make use of your friend's support skills to knock down lots of targets and get a high score.
Each stage has 3 challenge goals, and completing them grants rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Summer Memories</color>
Hang out with your friends and receive rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Strange Changes on the Beach: Fun in the Sun</color>
During the event, unlock limited-time stages and collect materials.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
Completing goals for Water Gun Fight and Strange Changes on the Beach: Fun in the Sun will grant rewards, including Rare Seashells.
You can use Rare Seashells to exchange for rewards in the shop.
Title: Summer! Swimsuits! Sea Time! Part One

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shaved Ice Shuffle</color>
Serve as many customers as possible in the time limit while earning high sales and satisfaction scores. Your accomplices will come visit at closing time, so be sure to serve up the shaved ice they've been craving.
There are three levels for sales goals and one for customer satisfaction. Achieving these goals will grant you rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Summer Memories</color>
Earn rewards for spending time with your accomplices.

<color=#FFD145>Strange Changes on the Beach: Waves of Fun</color>
 During the event, limited time stages will be unlocked where you can collect materials.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
During the event period, you can earn goal rewards, including Rainbow Umbrellas when you achieve goals in Shaved Ice Shuffle and Strange Changes on the Beach: Waves of Fun.
Rainbow Umbrellas can be exchanged for shop rewards.
Title: Summer! Swimsuits! Sea Time! Part Two

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
Thieves' Secrets is updated regularly, unlocking new Special Missions each time.
Special Missions are divided into three sections: Normal, Challenge, and Limited Time.
Normal and Challenge modes are permanent, and rewards can only be obtained the first time you clear each stage.
Limited Time is only available for a short period, and rewards can be obtained multiple times.

<color=#FFD145>Limited Time Period</color>
With each update, new Special Missions will be unlocked for a limited period of time.
During that time, the Limited Time stages will be available in Special Missions.
You only have a set amount of attempts for Limited Time per day, and all Limited Time stages share this daily limit.

<color=#FFD145>Unlock Rules</color>
During the unlock period, clearing the first stage of Challenge mode in Special Missions will unlock the corresponding Special Mission.
Outside of the unlock period, you can use Secret Keys to unlock certain Special Missions.
Previous challenge completion statuses cannot be reset.
Title: Thieves' Secrets

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Stage Unlock</color>
During the event, new stages can be unlocked every day.
When you clear a stage, you will receive a rating medal based on your performance. When you clear a stage's rank goal, you will unlock that stage.

<color=#FFD145>Stage Rating</color>
Eliminating targets in stages will increase your score. At the end of the stage, you will receive a rating medal based on your score.
Bronze: 500.
Silver: 500-1000.
Gold: 1000-3000.
Platinum: 3000 or higher.

<color=#FFD145>Accomplice Support</color>
As stages progress, more accomplices can join in on the Shooting Challenge to cheer you on and support you.
Accomplices can activate different support abilities, and when an accomplice participates in a stage with you, their ability level can increase. Increasing an accomplice's level strengthens abilities and reduces their cooldown.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Goals</color>
Individual stages have 3 challenge goals, and you can obtain rewards when you achieve each of these goals.
Goal completion does not affect the rating you receive at the end of a stage.
Title: Shooting Challenge

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Modify Weapon Cognition is a limited-time exchange event. This event is geared for players who accidentally spent the protagonist-only weapons Sennight Inferno or All In in the past.
This event is not permanent, so please be mindful of the exchange period.

<color=#FFD145>Exchange Rules</color>
You can spend certain quality weapons to trade for Sennight Inferno or All In. Several restrictions apply on the weapons you can exchange:
Equipped weapons can't be used.
Special protagonist-exclusive weapons can't be used.
Already forged weapons can't be used.
Locked weapons must be unlocked before they can be exchanged.
Title: Modify Weapon Cognition

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
This event's goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Visions of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure.

As you complete each goal, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels, Everlasting Incense, and the event item, Plum Blossom Bookmarks.
You can check the amount of rewards you've obtained from the event screen.
After the event ends, each Plum Blossom Bookmarks will be converted to 100 Konpaku Gems.

<color=#FFD145>Accumulated Rewards</color>
When you collect Plum Blossom Bookmarks, you can exchange them for the Rank VII Persona Cu Chulainn, its Seals, and Gecko Coins.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 2

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Visions of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure.
As you complete each goal, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Bookmarks.

<color=#FFD145>Quick Unlocking</color>
You can enter the event areas and complete goals early, even if you have not met the conditions for unlocking these goals.
These areas will remain unlocked even after the event ends.
Chapter 3 of the main story and its corresponding Palace Exploration goals cannot be Quick Unlocked.
Please continue the main story to complete these goals. The Quick Unlock function can only be used after completing the fusion-related goals in the Velvet Room for Traces of Dreams.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 2 Goals

strContent:
Collecting plum blossom bookmarks will allow you to obtain the Persona Cu Chulainn and its seal.
Exchange rewards will not consume plum blossom bookmarks.
Title: About Accumulated Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
In this event, you can gain various rewards by defeating bosses and completing goals.
There are two modes: Fixed Difficulty and Custom Difficulty.
In Fixed Difficulty, the bosses you take on have predetermined battle effects.
In Custom Difficulty, you can freely select which battle effects are applied.

<color=#FFD145>Battle Effects</color>
There are a variety of effects that can be activated in the battle. Some make the bosses stronger while others make your allies weaker or restrict your party in some way.
Battle effects are divided into three difficulties: Stable, Distressed, and Berserk, with the restrictions growing tougher as you move up to Berserk.
The Abnormality Level is determined by the selected battle effects.
Complete goals by clearing challenges at the specified Abnormality Level or above to earn rewards.
Battle effects you haven't yet unlocked in Custom Difficulty can be unlocked by completing certain Fixed Difficulty challenges.
Title: Trial of Thorns

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Music Player</color>
Choose the music you listen to when wandering the city. By creating your own playlist, you can select what tracks will play depending on the time of day and weather.
Some songs have unlock conditions, and you can play them continuously from the music player after unlocking.

<color=#FFD145>Playlist</color>
You can set a playlist that matches the weather and time of day.
When customizing, you can select anywhere from one to five songs.
Selectable Weather: Clear and Rain.
Selectable Times: After School, Evening, and Night.

<color=#FFD145>Playable Areas</color>
The playlist can only be used in daily life sections.
It can't be used while progressing through the main story or in Metaverse areas.
Title: Music Player

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
The Cycle of Fate will be available for 2 weeks. During the event, you can clear limited-time missions from the View Missions menu to get Oracle Ink.
Oracle Ink can be used to create Revelation Cards, as well as customize their set, mark, main attribute, and sub-attribute.
During the event, you can only create 2 Revelation Cards.
You can also use Oracle Ink to change the selected properties.
Title: Cycle of Fate

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
There are four sub-events included in the event: Pyramid Arc, Boss Battle, Missions, and Exchange Shop.

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>
Part 3 of Crossroads of Fate, Pyramid Arc, is a limited-time event.
Once the event period has ended, all events will close (excluding Pyramid Arc), and all unused Ancient Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to exchange your Rebel Coins for rewards before the events end.
Once the events end, Pyramid Arc will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue exploring any of its stages that you haven't completed.

<color=#FFD145>Pyramid Arc</color>
Explore a pyramid with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts.

<color=#FFD145>Boss Battle</color>
Challenge powerful bosses and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Missions</color>
Achieve event goals and obtain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Exchange Shop</color>
Use Rebel Coins obtained through missions to trade for rewards.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Pyramid Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Pyramid Arc is the third chapter of the Persona 5 special event.

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>
During the event period, all stages will be unlocked. To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.
In addition to clearing the stage missions, various challenges also await you within the Palace.

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Log</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Ancient Rebel Coins.
Rebel Coins can be exchanged for exclusive rewards through the Exchange Shop.
After the event ends, unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.

<color=#FFD145>Badge Book</color>
You can check which badges you've obtained from  events, Trials from the Sea of Souls, and Gates of the Nightmare Catcher.
These will be added to the badge screen after the events end.
Title: Pyramid Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock their corresponding Sinner of Distortion challenges.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each boss battle has multiple distortion levels.
When you eliminate a boss at a certain level, a new level is unlocked, and you will receive rewards corresponding to the current distortion level.

Bosses become more powerful at higher distortion levels.
You can switch between challenge mode and stamina mode.
Clearing a difficulty level for the first time on challenge mode will unlock the difficulty on stamina mode.
Challenging on stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing.

In stamina mode, you will be granted special effects in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>You will receive Ancient Rebel Coins for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period. Rebel Coins can be exchanged for rewards through the Exchange Shop.
Title: Boss Battle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Ancient Rebel Coins for missions cleared before the end of the event period.
Rebel Coins can be exchanged for rewards in the Exchange Shop.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your in-game mailbox, and unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Mission

strContent: Error: tnxotb-[StrUIPlayRule_strContent_239]
Title: NB[St][239]

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
• Log in to the game every day to receive that day's rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
• Rewards will be unlocked sequentially based on the total number of login days.
Daily rewards are unlocked at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Celebration Login Bonus

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
During the event, you can obtain rewards for logging in a certain number of days.
You can also earn rewards by collecting Celebratory Poppers, which can be obtained by completing missions.
Title: Half-Year Anniversary

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can open your personalized Half-Year Anniversary memories.
After you're done viewing your rewind, you can share your Half-Year Anniversary memories.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
During the event, you can obtain event rewards when you view and share your rewind.
Title: Half-Year Rewind

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
By purchasing items from Marthym's Shop during the event, you can obtain Marthym's Stamps.
Based on how many of these stamps you collect, you can claim feedback rewards.
Please keep in mind that your stamp total will be reset after the event ends.
Title: Purchase Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Half-Year Anniversary event, new and exclusive items will be added and made available to purchase in the Event Shop for a limited time.
Items have a purchase limit, and each package can only be purchased once.
Title: Event Shop

strContent:
Tycoon is a 4-player card game.
To win the game, you must get rid of all your cards before the other players.

<color=#FFD145>Arena Mode</color>
In Solo Mode, you can play against a CPU with a customizable difficulty and choose to play either 1 or 3 games for each match.
 In Ranked Match, play against other players, with every match consisting of three games.
Title: Tycoon

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Ranked Match</color>
An online multiplayer mode.
You will compete in 3 rounds, and earn Tycoon Points depending on your final ranking.
You can earn up to a maximum of 1000 Tycoon Points each week between both Ranked Match and Solo Mode.

<color=#FFD145>Rank</color>
There are 15 ranks in total. When the number of ★ earned in Ranked Match exceeds the maximum value of your current rank, you will be promoted.
Conversely, if you lose ★, you will be demoted.
The final rank is Legendary Tycoon, where your ranking is directly displayed instead of your number of ★.

<color=#FFD145>Changing Ranks</color>
For the Ordinarily Rich rank and below, you will not be demoted even if you lose all your ★.
For Millionaire rank and below, depending on your final ranking, you will earn either +2/+1/+0/-1 ★.
When above Millionaire rank, depending on your final ranking, you will earn either +2/+1/-1/-2 ★.
Legendary Tycoons will not lose their rank even if they lose ★.

<color=#FFD145>Rankings</color>
Rankings are based upon your rank, where players with higher ranks will be placer higher in the rankings.
When you become a Legendary Tycoon, your score will be calculated based on your final ranking in each game, and depending on your final ranking in each game, you will earn +2/+1/-1/-2 ★, and be ranked based on your score.

<color=#FFD145>Preparation After Successful Matching</color>
After successful matching, you can change your character while the game is preparing.
If multiple players select the same character, one player will be randomly selected to use them, and the other players will need to switch to another character.
If you cannot select a character during the preparation stage, a random character will be selected after 30 seconds.

<color=#FFD145>Season</color>
At the end of each season of Tycoon, you can earn rewards based on your final rank.
Your rank at the end of the season will also determine your rank at the start of the next season.
At the 1-2 <color=#FF423F>Beggar rank</color>, you will start the next season at the same rank.
At the 3-6 <color=#FF423F>Poor rank</color>, you will start the next season at 3 - Quite Poor 0★.
At the 7-10 <color=#FF423F>Commoner rank</color>, you will start the next season at 5 - Somewhat Poor 0★.
At the 11-14 <color=#FF423F>Rich rank</color>, you will start the next season at 7 - Ordinarily Common 0★.
At the 15 <color=#FF423F>Tycoon rank</color>, you will start the next season at 9 - Richly Common 0★.
Title: Ranked Match

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Solo Mode</color>
A mode where you play against CPU opponents.
You can select the number of rounds to play, as well as the difficulty level.

<color=#FFD145>Rewards</color>
The amount of rewards you earn is based on your final ranking. In order from 1st place to 4th place, you can earn 16/10/4/2 Tycoon Points in 1 Round, and 40/25/10/5 Tycoon Points in 3 Rounds.
You can earn up to a maximum of 1000 Tycoon Points each week between both Ranked Match and Solo Mode.
Title: Solo Mode

strContent:
You can select which character to use in Tycoon.
Characters can be unlocked by obtaining <color=#FF423F>Exclusive Invitations</color> at the Companio Shop.
In Ranked Match, if multiple players select the same character, one player will be randomly selected to use them, and the other players will need to switch to another character.
Title: Character Selection

strContent:
You can earn Tycoon Points by clearing Weekly, Season, and Career challenges.
Weekly challenges are updated every Sunday at 8 PM UTC.
Career includes challenges for all seasons.
Title: Challenges

strContent:
You can view all of your playing cards here.
There are also special custom card designs, and if you obtain them, you will be able to change the appearance of your cards.
Custom cards can be obtained either at the Exchange Shop or by raising Synergy.
Title: Design

strContent:
During the event, when you participate in Ranked Match or Solo Mode of Tycoon, you can obtain Tycoon Medals, and earn rewards for obtaining certain amounts.
There is a limit to how many Tycoon Medals you can obtain. On days 2 and 3 of the event, the daily Tycoon Medal Cap is raised by 600 each day.
Title: Tycoon

strContent:
Thieves' Secrets mode and Character Trial mode will be unlocked.
During the event, you can beat limited-time stages, obtain Secret Tickets, and exchange them for rewards in the Secret Shop.
In Character Trial challenges, you can try working with new allies in designated challenge stages.
Note that you can only use fixed teams; team configurations and training evaluations cannot be adjusted.
You can obtain rewards from the event screen after you clear a Character Trial for the first time.
Title: Character Trial

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Events</color>
There are four sub-events included in the event: Spaceport Arc, Sinner of Greed, Missions, and Exchange Shop.

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>
Part 4 of Crossroads of Fate, the Spaceport Arc, is a limited-time event.
Once the event period has ended, all events will close (excluding Spaceport Arc), and all unused Cosmic Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to trade your Rebel Coins for rewards before the events end.
Once the events end, the Spaceport Arc will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue exploring any of its stages that you haven't completed.

<color=#FFD145>Spaceport Arc</color>
Explore the Spaceport with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts.

<color=#FFD145>Sinner of Greed</color>
Challenge powerful bosses and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Missions</color>
Achieve event goals and obtain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Exchange Shop</color>
Use Rebel Coins to trade for rewards in the Exchange Shop.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Spaceport Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Spaceport Arc is the fourth chapter of the Persona 5 special event.

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>
During the event period, all stages will be unlocked. To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.
In addition to clearing the stage missions, various challenges also await you within the Palace.

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Log</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Cosmic Rebel Coins.
Rebel Coins can be exchanged for exclusive rewards through the Exchange Shop.
After the event ends, unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.

<color=#FFD145>Badge Book</color>
You can check which badges you've obtained from events, Trials from the Sea of Souls, and Gates of the Nightmare Catcher.
These will be added to the badge screen after the events end.
Title: Spaceport Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock their corresponding Distortion Level challenges.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each boss battle has multiple distortion levels.
When you eliminate a boss at a certain level, a new level is unlocked, and you will receive rewards corresponding to the current distortion level.

Bosses become more powerful at higher distortion levels.
You can switch between challenge mode and stamina mode.
Clearing a difficulty level for the first time on challenge mode will unlock the difficulty on stamina mode.
Challenging on stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing.

In stamina mode, you will be granted special effects in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>You will receive Cosmic Rebel Coins for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period. Rebel Coins can be exchanged for rewards through the Exchange Shop.
Title: Boss Battle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Mission Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Cosmic Rebel Coins for missions cleared before the end of the event period.
Rebel Coins can be exchanged for rewards at the Thieves' Exchange.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your mail, and unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Mission

strContent:
Mindscape
When you train the Mindscape of an ally, you can strengthen their skills and stats and activate Mindscape skills.

Stat Strengthening
This improves your ally's base stats.
Materials Required: Stardust Shards.

Basic Abilities
This greatly improves your ally's basic abilities.
Materials Required: Stardust Bells.

Rank Strengthening
By strengthening attribute ranks, you can strengthen the effects of your ally's corresponding attributes.
Materials Required: Stardust Bottles and Venus Bottles.

Skill Strengthening
This improves the effects of your ally's Persona skills.
Materials Required: Stardust Gems and Venus Gems.
Title: Mindscape

strContent:
Becomes playable once the protagonist reaches level 32 and clears the mission Metro of Desire.
Clearing objectives during the event period grants Dispatch Experience.
Title: Metro of Desire

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Visitors</color>
Visitors can come to visit your Thieves Den.
After a visit, you and your visitors will gain Visitor EXP, which can be collected from Manage Visitors.
By receiving Visitor EXP, you can boost your visit level with that visitor.
When your Visitor Level with a visitor reaches a certain point, you can obtain P Medals, and even unlock special conversations with them.

<color=#FFD145>Special Events</color>
When visitors continuously come to your Thieves Den, you will have a chance to trigger special dialog events that are unlocked daily.
The first time you trigger an event, you will gain extra Visitor EXP.

<color=#FFD145>Unspecified Visitors</color>
There may be times when visitors not specified in Manage Visitors come to your Thieves Den.
Title: Visits from Friends

strContent:
The event goals are divided into 4 categories: Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Visions of Ruin, and Trial of the Astrolabe.
As you complete each goal, you can obtain rewards such as Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Dango.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 3

strContent:
Collecting Plum Blossom Dango will allow you to obtain the Persona Black Frost, its seal, and Stardust Gems.
You won't need to spend Plum Blossom Dango for exchange rewards.
Title: About Accumulated Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Welcome Back Event</color>
The event becomes available when the protagonist is at or above level 15, you have cleared up to Traces of Dreams: Return to Shibuya in the main quest, and you have not logged in for a certain number of days.
If you haven't logged in for 8 or more days, you can receive rewards for logging in from the event letter.
If you haven't logged in for 15 or more days, along with the event letter, you can also earn various rewards with the Welcome Back Bonus.

The event can occur again after more than 30 days have passed since it was last active.
Title: Welcome Back

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Welcome Back Program event period, missions will unlock every day.
You can obtain rewards by completing these missions while the event is ongoing.
If you complete a certain amount of missions, you can obtain even more rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Bonus</color>
You can receive additional rewards when you complete missions if you purchase Bonus.
Title: Welcome Back Program

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, Marthym's Pop-up store will be available to sell limited time items.
Items have a purchase limit, and individual packages can only be purchased once.
Title: Marthym's Pop-Up Shop

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
In this event, you use Willpower to complete Stellae in the astrolabe. By completing them, you can obtain rewards. You can also get badges for completing goals.

<color=#FFD145>Stellae</color>
Stellae are divided into multiple types based on their battle difficulty and rewards.
As you progress, the levels and capabilities of enemies will increase, but the rewards you can get will also improve.

<color=#FFD145>Battles</color>
Battles end after a set number of turns.
If you are unable to defeat the Shadows within the set number of turns, or your party is defeated, you can try again with a different party. The Shadows' remaining HP will carry over from when the previous battle ended. The Stella is considered cleared once you have defeated all of the Shadows.
Each Stella has its own special effects that can strengthen or weaken your foes.
All Shadows will have their affinities set to normal.

<color=#FFD145>Resetting</color>
When resetting Stellae, the clear status of the Stella will be reset, and you can regain the Willpower and challenge attempts you've used.
You can press [Reset] on the left of the screen to reset the clear status of all Stellae.
Note that Stellae you've already obtained rewards from won't grant rewards again, even when you clear them once more.

<color=#FFD145>Points</color>
Your Willpower and challenge attempts are increased each week.
Title: Trial of the Astrolabe

strContent:
In the Thieves Den, you can use P Medals to purchase statues, music, and illustrations.
With these purchases, you will also get Thieves Den experience points.
P Medals are automatically generated as time passes, but must be manually claimed in order to be ready for use.
Once you reach the limit for unclaimed P Medals, more P Medals won't be generated until they are claimed.

<color=#FFD145>Den Level</color>
After you obtain a certain amount of Thieves Den experience points, your Den Level will automatically rise.
When this happens, your limit and generation speed for P Medals and Visitor EXP will increase, and you will unlock the ability to purchase certain items.

<color=#FFD145>Décor Benefits</color>
Statues and illustrations you've obtained will provide décor benefits, whether you have them displayed or not.
You can view these benefits under the Layout Effects category.
Title: Thieves Den

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Purchasing Items</color>
You can buy statues using P Medals from Den Design.
The amount of statues you can buy will increase as your Den Level increases.
Some important statues can only be unlocked for purchase after completing certain main story points.

<color=#FFD145>Item Placement</color>
Already-purchased statues can also be placed using Den Design.
Statues can only be placed in squares of specific colors.
As your Den Level increases, the amount of grid spaces will also increase.
Title: AAAAAA==

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
• In Akihabara Mystery Map, challenge your wits and puzzle-solving skills with Runa Dogenzaka while exploring Akihabara.
• After the event ends, the event mission Touring Akihabara will be regularly available.
• Thieves' Secrets is Runa Dogenzaka's Thieves' Secrets chapter. Clear Thieves' Secrets to earn Meta Jewels and other rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Missions</color>
• Event missions are separated into 2 categories: Adventure Story and City Life.• Clear missions during the event to earn Meta Jewels and other rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Quick Unlock</color>
• You can enter the event areas and complete goals early, even if you have not met the conditions for unlocking Missions. After the event ends, these areas will remain unlocked.
• The Quick Unlock function can only be used after completing the fusion-related goals in the Velvet Room for Traces of Dreams.
Title: Akihabara Mystery Map

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Collecting Keywords</color>
• In the mission Answer Sheet, join Runa Dogenzaka to solve puzzles in a brain-teasing treasure hunt. During the event, you can check your answer sheet to see the keywords you've collected.
• You can gather keywords in any order, but you can only take on one keyword mission at a time.
• More of the story will become available when you have gathered 3, 6, and 9 keywords. You cannot collect the next keyword until you have cleared the new story.
• You will immediately receive the rewards for collecting keywords after clearing each mission. You do not need to return to the answer sheet to claim them.

<color=#FFD145>Completing the Puzzle</color>
• After collecting all the keywords, you will need to put the keywords in the correct order to form a sentence.
• Drag the keywords to the correct place and complete the puzzle.
Title: Answer Sheet

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
At the Arcade, there are two types of Crane Games from which you can obtain plushies of various types and sizes.
Each try at a Crane Game machine costs money.
Each Crane Game machine contains fun-colored animal plushies, with 18 varieties of Common Plushies, 2 Rare Plushies with a fixed chance of appearing, and 1 Super Rare Plushie with a small chance of appearing.
You can display the plushies you've won in your home.
You can recycle your duplicate plushies to receive Arcade Tickets.
These tickets can be exchanged at the Arcade Shop for various prizes like Large Plushies, event-based Super Rare Plushies, and City Life items.

<color=#FFD145>About Available Plushies</color>
The lineup of Rare and Super Rare Plushies available in each machine is refreshed at regular intervals.
The time until the next refresh is displayed on screen.

<color=#FFD145>Win Rates</color>
Standard Win Rate: 35%
Jackpot System: If you don't win a plushie after 4 successive attempts, on each subsequent attempt you'll have a greater chance of winning, and you are guaranteed to win a plushie within 10 successive attempts.
Overall Win Rate: 37%
With regard to the Jackpot System, the number of successive attempts made is counted on a per-machine basis.

<color=#FFD145>Plushie Drop Rates</color>
When you successfully win a plushie, it's rarity is determined by the following rates.
Common Plushie: 89%
Rare Plushie: 9%
Super Rare Plushie: 2%
Title: Playing Crane Games

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
・You can select multiple plushies from the list to recycle.
Only plushies that you have left over can be recycled, and you will be left with at least one of each type.
Plushies that you have placed in you room cannot be recycled.

<color=#FFD145>Recycle Rewards</color>
Conversion rates vary depending on the time of recycling and the type of plushie.
All plushies that meet the conditions to be recycled can be exchanged for arcade exchange vouchers.
Title: Exchanging Plushies

strContent: AAAAAA==
Title: Jose's Dicey Adventure

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Introduction</color>  
While enjoying a quiet day in Shibuya, Lufel and Wonder are pulled into the Metaverse due to a Navigator malfunction. Before they are able to reunite, an unfamiliar red-haired girl points a weapon at them...
There are five sub-events included in this event: Laboratory Arc Part 1, Jose's Dicey Adventure, Sinner of Melancholy, Missions, and Crimson Illusion.  

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>  
The Persona 5 Royal special event, Crossroads of Fate: Laboratory Arc Part 1, is a limited-time event. Once the event period has ended, all events will close (excluding Laboratory Arc Part 1), and all unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems. Be sure to trade your Rebel Coins for rewards before the events end.
Once the events end, the Laboratory Arc Part 1 will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue exploring any of its stages that you haven't completed.  

<color=#FFD145>Laboratory Arc Part 1</color>  
Set in a mysterious laboratory, reunite with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts on another adventure, as you take down foes and collect hidden treasure.  

<color=#FFD145>Jose's Dicey Adventure</color>  
Team up with a mysterious young boy called Jose, as you roll dice and traverse through the Metaverse. Collect flowers along the way, and exchange them with Jose for useful items.  

<color=#FFD145>Sinner of Melancholy</color>  
Put your strength to the test in challenging boss battles.  

<color=#FFD145>Missions</color>  
Clear missions during the event to earn valuable rewards.  

<color=#FFD145>Crimson Illusion</color>  
Exchange the Destiny Badges collected during your adventures for valuable items.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Laboratory Arc Part 1

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>  
After meeting a red-headed beauty and reuniting with Joker and Mona, the thieves soon discover that the Palace they find themselves in is somewhat different to the others...
Crossroads of Fate: Laboratory Arc Part 1 is the first part of the latest collaboration story with Persona 5 Royal.  

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>  
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages. To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.  
In addition to clearing stage missions, several challenges and powerful foes await you within the Palace.  

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Record</color>  
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn goal rewards and Destiny Badges.  
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for valuable rewards at the Crimson Illusion.  
After the event ends, unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems. The badge rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Laboratory Arc Part 1

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock higher level Sinner of Distortion challenges in order.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each Sinner of Distortion has multiple distortion levels.
Each time you eliminate a boss, a new level is unlocked, and you receive a challenge score corresponding to the current distortion level.
A higher distortion level means more powerful bosses and a higher challenge score upon victory.
If you clear a difficulty level for the first time in challenge mode you will unlock that difficulty in stamina mode.
Taking on a challenge in stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing it.
In stamina mode, you will be granted strong traits in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>
You will receive Destiny Badges for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Gallery Auction.
Title: Recollections of Fate

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Destiny Badges for action goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Gallery Auction.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your mail, and unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Missions

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Shadow of Wrath: Cupid and Shadow of Wrath: Aegipan have been unleashed in Shadows of Wrath, a limited-time, high-difficulty challenge event.
There are various timed deadlines to watch out for, so please be careful.
Take on Shadow of Wrath to obtain Joy Medals and exchange them for rare items in the Land of Fortune.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Levels</color>
Each time you defeat an enemy, a new distortion level is unlocked.
When the level increases, the enemy's difficulty and actions will grow stronger.

<color=#FFD145>Ranking Rewards</color>
After defeating an enemy, your ranking will be set according to the difficulty of the challenge and number of turns your allies took in combat.
Taking fewer turns and clearing higher difficulties will increase your rank.
Ranks will be categorized into certain divisions based on difficulty and number of turns.
At the end of each challenge, rank rewards for your rank division will be sent to your Mail screen.
When each challenge period ends, your ranking will be set.
Unfinished battle records will not be counted in the ranking, so be sure to finish challenges before the end period.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Goals</color>
Complete the goals set for each challenge before the event ends to earn challenge rewards.
Unclaimed challenge rewards will be sent to your Mail screen after the event ends.
Title: Shadow of Katayama

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
This event's goals are separated into 4 parts:Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Visions of Ruin, and City Adventure. As you complete each goal, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels, Everlasting Incense, and the event item, Plum Blossom Bookmarks.
You can check the amount of rewards you've obtained from the event screen.
After the event ends, each Plum Blossom Bookmark will be converted to 100 Konpaku Gems.

<color=#FFD145>Accumulated Rewards</color>
When you collect Plum Blossom Bookmarks, you can exchange them for the Rank VII Persona Siegfried, its Seals, and Stardust Gems.
Title: Unconditional Love: Final Phase

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Visions of Ruin, and City Adventure.
As you complete each goal, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Bookmarks.

<color=#FFD145>Quick Unlocking</color>
You can enter the event areas and complete goals early, even if you have not met the conditions for unlocking these goals.
These areas will remain unlocked even after the event ends.
Chapter 3 of the main story and its corresponding Palace Exploration goals cannot be Quick Unlocked.
Please continue the main story to complete these goals. The Quick Unlock function can only be used after completing the fusion-related goals in the Velvet Room for Traces of Dreams.
Title: Unconditional Love: Final Phase

strContent: Collecting Plum Blossom Bookmarks will allow you to obtain the Persona Siegfried and its seal. Exchange rewards will not consume Plum Blossom Bookmarks.
Title: About Accumulated Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
Lunar New Years Gifts can be obtained from the following events during the Lunar New Year period.
Lunar New Years Gifts contain a certain amount of rewards, and by sending gifts, you can receive the rewards inside.
By sending gifts, you can receive progress rewards during the event.
You can receive up to 20 gifts total during the event period, and up to 3 gifts per day.
After the end of the event period, Lunar New Years Gifts can no longer be used.
Title: Sending Red Envelopes

strContent:

• Log in to the game every day to receive that day's rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
• Rewards will be unlocked sequentially based on the total number of login days.
Daily rewards are unlocked at 8 PM UTC.

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can earn Cat Food by completing Daily Cat Chow missions.
By selecting Treasure Hunt, you can offer a specified number of Cat Food cans to have the Orange Tabby search for hidden treasures.
The Treasure List shows all the treasures hidden by the Orange Tabby.
Collecting the Orange Tabby's favorite trinkets, Cloth Tiger Dolls, allows you to start the event mission Paw it Forward.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Refresh Rules</color>
During the event period, daily missions will refresh at 8 PM UTC every day.
Title: Tabby's Treasure Hunt

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Lunar New Year festival in Motomachi Chinatown: Dance with the Lions</color>
To celebrate the Lunar New Year, a lively festival event is being held in Chinatown.
Join Yaoling Li, an exchange student from China, as you partake in the traditions of the festival, and investigate various anomalies occurring throughout Chinatown.

<color=#FFD145>Lunar Shooting Challenge</color>
In the shooting minigame found at the festival in Chinatown, face the mythical yearbeast known as Nian.
Partake in the event with your allies as you shoot targets to scare off the beast.

Complete stage and challenge goals to earn rewards.

<color=#FFD145>The Yearbeast Strikes</color>
The Lunar New Year is just around the corner, and yet Chinatown seems to be shrouded in a strange sense of malaise, as though everyone's lost their festive spirit...

In order to save this important festival, the Phantom Thieves decide to venture into the Metaverse to reclaim the people's lost desire.
The trial event will run for 3 weeks, with new bosses being unlocked to face each week.
Complete battle goals to earn rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
Progress through the event story, Lunar New Year festival in Motomachi Chinatown: Dance with the Lions, and complete challenge goals in Lunar Shooting Challenge and The Yearbeast Strikes to earn challenge rewards, such as the Chinese Knot.
At the Lunar Exchange Shop, you can trade Chinese Knots for fabulous rewards.
Title: Dancing with the Happy-Go-Lucky Lions

strContent: AAAAAA==
Title: Dancing with the Happy-Go-Lucky Lions

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
In this event, you can gain various rewards by defeating bosses and completing goals.
There are two modes: Fixed Difficulty and Custom Difficulty.
In Fixed Difficulty, the bosses you take on have predetermined battle effects.
In Custom Difficulty, you can freely select which battle effects are applied.

<color=#FFD145>Battle Effects</color>
There are a variety of effects that can be activated in the battle. Some make the bosses stronger while others make your allies weaker or restrict your party in some way.
Battle effects are divided into three difficulties: Stable, Distressed, and Berserk, with the restrictions growing tougher as you move up to Berserk.
The Abnormality Level is determined by the selected battle effects.
Complete goals by clearing challenges at the specified Abnormality Level or above to earn rewards.
Battle effects you haven't yet unlocked in Custom Difficulty can be unlocked by completing certain Fixed Difficulty challenges.
Title: Boss Battle

strContent: AAAAAA==
Title: Shooting Challenge

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Story</color>
A fun story available during the Valentine's period. Spend the time with everyone and have a wonderful Valentine's.
You can gain mission rewards from clearing missions.

<color=#FFD145>Side Story</color>
Help your companions regain their desire for Valentine's Day.
Take on boss battles and puzzles to earn the event item Pieces of Chocolates and give them to your companions to unlock exclusive Valentine's stories.
On a certain day during the event, youar Valentine's Points will reach their maximum and you will receive confessions from companions that you went out on a date with. Be sure to choose your companions carefully.
You can receive special rewards by playing through these stories.

<color=#FFD145>Boss Battles</color>
Defeat the Shadows lurking in the Metaverse to restore your companions' desires and make the most of Valentine's together.
Boss battles consist of seven stages and will be unlocked sequentially during the event period. Please be sure not to miss out on these challenges.
First-time clear rewards are available for each stage.
Title: Take Your Love

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Story</color>
A fun story available during the Valentine's period. Spend the time with everyone and have a wonderful Valentine's.
While the event is ongoing, event stories will become unlocked after certain dates or conditions have been met.
You can gain mission rewards from clearing missions.
Title: Event Story

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Side Story</color>
Help your companions regain their desire for Valentine's Day.
Take on boss battles and puzzles to earn the event item Pieces of Chocolates and give them to your companions to increase Valentine's Points. After reaching a certain amount of Valentine's Points, that companion's Valentine's story will become available to you.
Confession day is on the twelfth day of the event (February 24). You will receive confession invitations from Companions with the highest Valentine's Points. Choose your companions wisely to receive their special Valentine's chocolate. (The first special chocolate you receive can be placed as decoration in your house.)
If you receive invitations from three or more girls, a special spine-tingling story will occur.
* Use the confession switch available on the Side Story page to confirm which companions will send you an invitation on confession day. You can obtain special awards from confession stories.
Title: Side Story

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Boss Battles</color>
Defeat the Shadows lurking in the Metaverse to restore your companions' desires and make the most of Valentine's together.
The Boss Battle event consists of seven stages. In the first six stages, you can gain Chocolate Energy. As you gain more energy, allies will receive greater buffs.
Confront the boss in the final stage. During this battle, the special skill Love Bomb will become available. This skill uses Chocolate Energy and can be activated multiple times throughout the battle.
You can gain first-time clear rewards when you clear each stage.
The boss stage has five difficulties. First-time clear rewards are available for each difficulty. You can also use Stamina to challenge difficulties 1 - 4 to receive regular rewards.
Title: Boss Battle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
You can obtain random puzzle pieces by clearing daily missions during the event.
You can also receive progress rewards based on how many puzzle pieces you've obtained.
If you complete the puzzle, you can obtain special rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Refresh Rules</color>
The daily missions will refresh at 8 PM (UTC) every day during the event.

<color=#FFD145>Puzzle Piece Rules</color>
You can check which puzzle pieces you've obtained by pressing [Start Game].
Any puzzle pieces you acquire after you've obtained every puzzle piece will be converted into a small amount of Konpaku Gems.
Title: Puzzle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
• Log in to the game every day to receive that day's rewards. Event Rewards
• Rewards will be unlocked sequentially based on the total number of login days. Daily rewards are unlocked at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Login Bonus

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
By purchasing items from Marthym's Shop during the event, you can obtain Marthym's Stamps. Based on how many of these stamps you collect, you can claim feedback rewards.
Please keep in mind that your stamp total will be reset after the event ends.
Title: Purchase Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Half-Year Anniversary event, new and exclusive items will be added and made available to purchase in the Event Shop for a limited time. Items have a purchase limit, and each package can only be purchased once.
Title: Event Shop

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock the corresponding distortion level in challenge mode.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each boss battle has multiple distortion levels.
When you defeat a boss at a certain level, a new level is unlocked, and you will receive rewards corresponding to the current distortion level.
The higher the distortion level, the tougher the boss and systems become.
You can switch between challenge mode and stamina mode.
Clearing a difficulty level for the first time in challenge mode will unlock that difficulty level and the previous difficulty levels in stamina mode.
Challenges in stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards upon clearing.
In stamina mode, you will be granted special effects in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Hardest Difficulty</color>
If you manage to clear Difficulty Lv. 30, you will be able to take on the Highest Difficulty from a certain date.
On the Highest Difficulty, you will be able to battle the boss up to three times, and the boss's HP will be recorded each time you fight it.
Each Phantom Thief can only be used in battle a certain number of times, and once they've reached that battle count, they won't be able to battle again. By using the reset option, you can reset the thieves' battle count and the boss's HP.
During the battle, when the boss has used all of its actions, the battle will end, and the number of actions for that battle will be recorded. If allies are defeated in battle, the number of turns will be added.
After the event ends, all players who attempted the Hardest Difficulty will be awarded with a badge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>
Clear challenge goals before the end of the event period to earn amazing mission rewards and Prison Rebel Coins.
You can trade the Prison Rebel Coins you've obtained for valuable limited-time items at the Exchange Shop.
Title: Recollections of Fate

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Twins Arc is a limited-time event.
To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.

<color=#FFD145>Missions</color>
By completing missions before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Prison Rebel Coins.
These Rebel Coins can be exchanged for exclusive rewards at the Exchange Shop.
After the event ends, unused Prison Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Mission rewards will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Twins Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
There are four sub-events included in the event: Event Story, Recollections of Fate, Goals, and Exchange.

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Twins Arc is a limited-time event.
Once the event period has ended, all sub-events excluding the Event Story will close, and all unused Prison Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to exchange your Rebel Coins for rewards before the events end.
After the event has ended, the Event Story will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue challenging any of its stages that you haven't completed.

<color=#FFD145>Event Story</color>
Experience an all-new story with the twin wardens.

<color=#FFD145>Recollections of Fate</color>
Challenge powerful bosses to earn rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Goals</color>
Complete event goals to earn rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Exchange</color>
Use the Prison Rebel Coins that you have collected to exchange for valuable rewards.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Twins Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Phantom Festivities</color>
During the event, you can earn special rewards for playing through the event story.

<color=#FFD145>Fresh Start Fortunes</color>
Log in each day during the event to draw a fortune.
You will receive rewards based on your luck for the day.
You cannot draw fortunes for days that have passed. Please do not forget to draw your fortune each day.
Title: New Year's Blessings!

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
During the event, you can draw one fortune each day. Depending on your fortune for the day, you can claim special rewards.
There are five fortunes: Great Luck, Fair Luck, Good Luck, Average Luck, and Slight Luck.
Rewards will differ based on the fortune you draw.
You can only draw one fortune per day. If you do not draw your fortune, it will not be available the next day.
Title: Fresh Start Fortunes

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
During the event, play through the story and earn rewards.
Title: Phantom Festivities

strContent: <color=#FFD145>Extra Mode</color>Only one round is played each time. You can earn 24/15/6/3 Tycoon Points depending on your final ranking. There is a limit to the number of Tycoon Points you can earn each week, up to 1,000 points combined across "Ranked Match" and "Solo Mode"<color=#FFD145>Play Rules</color>Depending on the results, Rich and Tycoon ranked players will receive Extra Coins, while Poor and Beggar ranked players will lose Extra Coins. Tycoon ranked players will earn double the amount of coins of Rich players. Beggar players will lose triple the amount of coins of Poor players. If the number of Extra Coins lost exceeds the number of Extra Coins you have, you will lose all currently held Extra Coins with no further penalty. In this case, the number of extra coins earned by Rich and Tycoon ranked players will scale accordingly. If the number of Extra Coins exceeds the limit, received Extra Coins will be doubled and no more will be acquired. In this case, the number of Extra Coins lost by Poor and Beggar players will also decrease.<color=#FFD145>Scoring Rules</color>The maximum expected profit for each game = base points x multiplier. ・The initial base points are 100 points, and Tycoon and Rich ranked players receive additional points after playing all of their cards. ・The initial multiplier is determined by the type of arena in which you participate. The multiplier doubles each time a Revolution or Counter Revolution is performed during a game. Any player can also use items to further increase the point multiplier. ・Each stage has a maximum score limit.<color=#FFD145>Multiplier Boost Rules</color>At the start of the game, players can choose from the following: Boost - Multiplier x2, Super Boost - Multiplier x4 (requires one Super Double card to use.), or No Boost - No change to multiplier.<color=#FFD145>Game Types</color>・Happy Mode arenas are divided into Normal Arena, Advanced Arena, and Top Arena. ・Normal Arena: Base Multiplier - 2x, Required Gold - 1,000, Entrance Fee - 100 gold, Top Reward - 20,000 gold. ・Advanced Arena: Base Multiplier - 5x, Required Gold - 20,000, Entrance Fee - 500 gold, Top Reward - 100,000 gold. ・Top Arena: Base Multiplier - x20, Required Gold - 100,000, Entrance Fee - 2,00 gold, Top Reward - 400,000 gold. <color=#FFD145>Season Calculation</color>・In Happy Mode, your total will be tallied at the end of each Tycoon season, and your gold will be adjusted for the new season after calculations are finished.・Calculation formula: Gold after reset = (Gold before reset - 10,000) x 0.2 + 10,000. If the calculation result is less than 10,000, it will be reset to 10,000 gold. ・If the calculation result is more than 88,888, it will be reset to a maximum of 88,888 gold.・Each season's ranking is determined by the amount of Tycoon Gold you possess. <color=#FFD145>Bankruptcy</color> ・If your current gold is less than 1,000 Tycoon Gold, you can receive 2,000 Tycoon Gold as bankruptcy relief. ・You can receive this up to three times per day.
Title: Extra Mode

strContent: Event Rules  Extra Mode is now open! • Once you have collected enough Tycoon Medals, you can exchange them for rewards on the event page. • There is a limit to how many Tycoon Medals you can obtain. On days 2 and 3 of the event, the daily limit Tycoon Medal Cap is raised by 600 each day.  How to Obtain Tycoon Medals • During the event period, participate in games of Tycoon and you will receive the event item Tycoon Medals in addition to the usual rewards. • If you play in Solo Mode (1 Round), you will receive 80 Tycoon Medals when rewards are tallied. • If you play in Solo Mode (3 Rounds), you will receive 200 Tycoon Medals when rewards are tallied. • If you play in Ranked Match, you will receive 200 Tycoon Medals when rewards are tallied. • If you play in Friendly Match, you will receive 200 Tycoon Medals when rewards are tallied.
Title: Tycoon Typhoon

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shady Commodities</color>
Shady Commodities is a system that allows you to purchase items sold in various in-game shops without having to visit them directly as you normally would.

<color=#FFD145>Available Items</color>
Most items available in shops can also be purchased from Shady Commodities.
However, the following shops are excluded:
Airsoft Shop, Takemi's Clinic, food shops (crêpe shop, Boom Bang Burger, school store, etc), fishing shops, and club activities shops.

You can purchase items from more areas when you raise Mio Natsukawa's Synergy level.
You will be able to purchase items from Shibuya at Lv. 1 and Zoshigaya at Lv. 5.
The item selection, stock status, and purchase conditions for the stores in each area are the same on Shady Commodities.
Therefore, you will be unable to purchase items from stores on Shady Commodities if you do not meet the necessary social stat or synergy rank requirements, or have not unlocked the area.

<color=#FFD145>Pricing</color>
Items on Shady Commodities share the same price as their in-store counterparts.
There are no additional handling fees or price hikes.
Certain items exclusive to Shady Commodities may be cheaper than what you find in-store.

<color=#FFD145>Stock</color>
Shady Commodities' stock is tied to each shop's stock inventory.
If you buy out an item through Shady Commodities, the corresponding shop will also run out of the same item.
Items are restocked at the same time as regular stores, so you may need to wait for items to be restocked.
Title: Shady Commodities

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
You can earn rewards for clearing each event mission.
When all missions have been completed, you can earn a complete set that includes hidden items and exclusive rewards.
Title: Capsule Toys

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Unlocking Plans</color>
Lufel's "Business" Plans III and IV will unlock after you have completed all of the missions.
These missions have seven steps each, and the next step will be unlocked after you complete a certain number of missions.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Rewards</color>
After you complete a mission, you can receive its rewards.
You can also receive special rewards once you complete a certain number of missions.
If you complete all of the missions, you can obtain fantastic rewards.
Title: About Lufel's "Business" Plan EX
